name: rfissa
ingredients: 1 free-range chicken (1.3 kg) or 5 chicken thighs
A few strands of pure saffron
1 small bunch of parsley and coriander
For serving: 400 g of flour, 1/2 teaspoon of salt, 250 ml of water (more or less), Sunflower oil (for layering and cooking the msemen/tride)
steps: Prepare the broth: Brown the chicken in olive and sunflower oil. Add the onions, spices (turmeric, ginger, ras el hanout, saffron), salt, and pepper.
Add the bunch of parsley/coriander, lentils, and fenugreek (previously soaked). Cover with water and let simmer.
Prepare the msemen (tride): Mix the flour, salt, and warm water to form a smooth dough. Knead, shape into balls, and let rest.
Roll out the balls thinly, brush with oil, and fold into squares (msemen). Cook the msemen in a pan.
Once the msemen are cooked, let them cool and then cut them into small pieces (tride).
Remove the herb bunch from the broth. Add the clarified butter (smen).
To serve: Arrange the msemen/tride pieces on a large platter. Place the chicken in the center and generously pour the broth with lentils over it.
